summary: The Green Climate Fund Authorization Act of 2025 authorizes appropriations for contributions to the Green Climate Fund, an international fund aimed at assisting developing countries in mitigating and adapting to climate change. The bill emphasizes the importance of climate justice, environmental justice, and recognizes the need for increased climate financing to meet the goals of the Paris Agreement. It authorizes $4 billion for each of the fiscal years 2026 and 2027 to be appropriated and outlines the United States policy for climate financing. The bill also includes definitions.
